reviews.sentence: Disappointed in DoubleTree. let us start with the good things A couple of cookies upon arrival excellent task chair at desk in the room comfortable Sweet Sleeper bed new lounge chair with ottoman corner room with balcony overlooking outdoor swimming pool. Next the not so good things We did not get the usual Hilton exuberant friendly welcome upon arivalOur room 637 on the Hilton Honors floor had not been properly cleaned the desk had a layer of sticky dirt which we tried to clean off with a towel the windows were coated with an opaque film that would not rub off we asked Joan the housekeeper to try to clean them she tried but then apologized that it was impossible to removethe cloudiness from the glass the balcony rails had peeling paint and were coveredwith bird droppings the cement floor of the balcony had not been finished was rough with pieces of concrete and dirt and the table was covered in dirt. The bathroom was tiny and had only two hand towels two washcloths and two bath towels. Four of each is the norm for a couple staying in a room. The sheer curtains had a big rip in them. The little table for the little coffee maker was totally useless. No mini fridge. Traffic and train noise when the balcony door was open. Dining in the Regatta Grille was unrealistically expensive and a little depressing. We were the only customers it felt dark and unwelcoming. The quality of the food was definitely not up to the price we paid. We skipped the expensive breakfast and instead had coffee at a nearby service area on Interstate 90We will not be staying at any DoubleTree properties again.

Nice updated room but no free breakfast. The meeting room was average with good wifi connection. The room itself was good. Bed was comfortable but not the pillows. Decent counter space in the bathroom with shelving in the shower to actually be able to put bottles on them. Free coffee in room and outside the restaurant since breakfast itself is not included in the room rate.

We unfortunately did not have a great experience at this hotel. When we arrived the hotel was not cleaned. There were hairs on the toilet seat used kleenex in the box and a dirty towel hanging up. The supervisor who came to help was very nice and helpful but unfortunately that did not fix the uncleanliness of the room. There is no breakfast and for the price you would expect a continental breakfast. Also the reception at the front desk was not friendly and welcoming. I definitely would not visit this particular hotel again.
Nice rooms welcoming lobyFlight ran late. Stopped running shuttle at midnight left my son and I without ride to hotel. Had to incur additional cost for taxi. Poor service.

Huge hotel nice staff boring hotel. Spent the night here recently. For such a large hotel they should have more elevators. I waited every time far longer than needed as did others I heard talking about it. I often take the stairs but not with suitcases when I am on the 7th floor. My room was fine with a lovely balcony but terrible wifi. And the hotel restaurant was boring and way too expensive for the quality of the food.

Good enough. The hotel is a minimalistic place with all necessary facilities. The receptionist may at night be not very polite. The room is good and complete with all facilities. It was interesting in which they permitted four of us to share a room. This kept our expenses to minimum.

Glad I stayed on h points. I never would have paid full price for this hotel but it was good for points. The rooms were large and clean and we got a nice view of the courtyard and pool. The Wi Fi was a disaster though the local tech was very helpful in getting it to work. I just do not understand why hilton has its bizarre fetish about supplying good free WiFi. I do not know why the hilton uses such tiny amenity bottles more plastic than product seems like a waste and I had always welcome a makeup mirror. Ok but most important DO NOT EAT at the restaurant. Bring your own or eat before you check in but the restaurant is a shocking ripof. We got charged 80 for a couple glasses of wine a club sandwich and Caesar salad WHAT. I understand breakfast is over 17. This is not the Ritz it is a basic roadside motel. Management needs to seriously rethink that restaurant. Front desk staff were super nice and gave us water to go when I told them about restaurant sticker shock.

should not have to pay 140 for one night of staring at a stained water damaged ceiling. The carpet was also rippled and the TV was small. I should have read the reviews and looked at the pictures. Obviously they do not spend enough time cleaning or updating the facility.

The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The location is great and the staff is very friendly not to mention the cookies when you arrive. The pool is great both the indoor and the outdoor. The restaurant is reasonable and friendly. The bar has a new rule in place where the bartender must measure out the drinks. The drinks are expensive to begin with but making it that precise feels worse. Also when charging for a double drink it cost double. It should only be 15 times the cost.

Not Hilton standards. The lobby is very inviting but room is dated bathroom is small and no fridge or microwave in room unles you ask for it. Housekeeping did not clean room until we complained. They came in at 9 pm to do it so we could not use our washroom to get ready for swimming in the pool plus we were upset that we had to complain to get the room cleaned especially after paying over 120 dollars American per night. We were offered more honors points but we have yet to see those points. Overall not the greatest experience and probAbly would not go back.

Cookies. Great place friendly staff clean rooms shuttle to airport move restaurant but food is expensive very convenient location nice pool good internet I would stay there again and recommend it to others and I am buyiG their bed.
Clean fresh canot beat the price.

Graduation weekend. We had a series of problems with rooms not cleaned keys that did not work and rude front desk clerks. Our billing was not correct and has not been resolved yet. The location is good and the rooms are set up well but we were paying a higher price because it was graduation so we expected service to be better.
Great price from Hotelcom. Indoor outdoor pool for the kids was great fun.

Loved our Stay will always stay here when we go to New York. Like the location and the price and it was really nice. I will stay here everytime I come I liked everything except for the girl that checked us in got our room rate wrong and now we have to wait up to 7 days to get the other 200 back that she tried charging us extra.
Much nicer than I expected and very well priced.

We got a great price considering the big Syracuse Nationals Car Show event. Their full breakfast included with the room is really good including the made to order omelette. Beds are super comfortable pillow top mattresses. Front desk staff was great and the free cookies were an unexpected bonus.
Top rated hotel.

Great Experience. Hotel is updated and very clean. Friendly staff. Pool are is exceptional especially for the price. Well priced easy access off the highway. Also close to nearby restaurants. Very easy one night stay.

Nice and clean. Very nice and clean. Restaurant is had good options and service was great. Easy stay for business. Comfortable bed and close to Syracuse Airport. If you are looking for a nicely priced hotel convenient to the airport this is it.
